column3: @MarcoFalke what does "Don't show integer progress in progress bar. (Already shown in front\n  of progress bar)" mean? What change is it?\n
I see something like this with the current master:
@paveljanik By default it shows the percentage twice: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8371#issuecomment-235840248. (Maybe not on osx)\n

Thanks for doing this.

Question:

> Remove the "Progress increase per hour" information, as it is
> redundant to the already displayed information and sounds potentially
> confusing.

Where is the information already visible?
Why is it confusing?
IMO "progress increase per hours" is the only information which could one allow to get a feeling of how-fast he/she is currently syncing. But
@MarcoFalke Aha! Thanks. Yes, I do not see it here. BTW - the progressbar on OS X doesn't show, what is 100%, it is a bold line showing nothing.\n

Maybe we need to distinct the percentage information over PlatformStyles in order to not just display a non-value progress bar.\nOr maybe there is a QT setting to not display the percentage information on a progress bar.\n

@jonasschnelli Example: If you are synced 90% and the "Progress increase per hour" is 10%, then the estimated time until synced is 1 hour.

Or: If you are synced 0% and the increase is 100% per hour, the estimated time is 1 hour.

@MarcoFalke: I just though, the "Estimated time left" doesn't allow you to directly get a feeling on how fast you are syncing (in a comparable manner).\nIMO most information on the screen is redundant (except of maybe the last-block-time).\n
What about the nPowTargetSpacing change?\nMy understanding is, that once we have the headers-only-chain complete, we can give an adequate information about the remaining amount of blocks.\n

@jonasschnelli: As I understand your code, the gui may miss headers sometimes, so you added the "`fHeaders`-shortcut" to make sure the gui always knows the best header. Though, it seems a waste of resources to do this the way it is now: First, lock `cs_main` for each header, then drop the header if it is older than 30 days... This seems wasteful to me.\n\nI don't think we should assume the gui kno
Yes. I think https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8821 makes sense. Will test soon.\n

>  Or maybe there is a QT setting to not display the percentage information on a progress bar.

See hunk above
